means: 跟踪( track的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: By devious means she tracked down the other woman.
sentence.Network_cn: 她通过不正当的手段追查到了另外那个女人。

sentence.Network_en: He tracked down his cousin and uncle. The latter was sick.
sentence.Network_cn: 他追查到了堂弟和叔叔的下落，发现叔叔这时正在病中。

sentence.Network_en: A Federal Court case had been fast tracked to Wednesday.
sentence.Network_cn: 联邦法庭的一桩案件提前到星期三审理。

entry.def: A track is a narrow road or path.

example.ex: We set off once more, over a rough mountain track.
example.tran: 我们沿着一条崎岖的山间小路再度出发。

entry.def: A track is a piece of ground, often oval-shaped, that is used for races involving athletes, cars, bicycles, horses, or dogs called greyhounds.

example.ex: The two men turned to watch the horses going round the track.
example.tran: 那两个男人转身观看赛马沿赛道而行。

example.ex: ...the athletics track.
example.tran: 田径跑道

entry.def: Railway tracks are the rails that a train travels along.

example.ex: A woman fell on to the tracks.
example.tran: 一名女子摔倒在铁轨上。

entry.tran: (CD、唱片或磁带上的一首)歌曲，乐曲
entry.def: A track is one of the songs or pieces of music on a CD, record, or tape.

example.ex: Graeme Naysmith has produced two of the ten tracks on this album.
example.tran: 格雷姆·内史密斯创作了这张专辑十首歌中的两首。

entry.def: Tracks are marks left in the ground by the feet of animals or people.

example.ex: The only evidence of pandas was their tracks in the snow...
example.tran: 熊猫活动的唯一迹象是它们留在雪地上的足迹。

example.ex: McKee suddenly noticed tire tracks on the bank ahead.
example.tran: 麦基突然注意到前方岸边的轮胎痕迹。

entry.def: If you track animals or people, you try to follow them by looking for the signs that they have left behind, for example the marks left by their feet.

example.ex: He thought he had better track this wolf and kill it...
example.tran: 他认为最好跟踪这只狼，杀了它。

example.ex: I followed him, tracking him in the snow until finally he got tired.
example.tran: 我跟着他，在雪地里追踪他，直到他最终体力不支。

entry.def: To track someone or something means to follow their movements by means of a special device, such as a satellite or radar.

example.ex: Our radar began tracking the jets...
example.tran: 我们的雷达开始追踪喷气式飞机的动向。

example.ex: Forecasters are also tracking hurricane Josephine.
example.tran: 气象预报员也在追踪飓风“约瑟芬”的动向。

entry.def: If you track someone or something, you investigate them, because you are interested in finding out more about them.

example.ex: If it's possible, track the rumour back to its origin...
example.tran: 如果可能，应追查谣言的源头。

example.ex: The player is being tracked by Juventus.
example.tran: 该选手正为尤文图斯队所追踪关注。

entry.tran: (同等年龄、能力的孩子组成的)班级，班组
entry.def: In a school, a track is a group of children of the same age and ability who are taught together.

entry.tran: 把(学生)按能力分班(或组)
entry.def: To track students means to divide them into groups according to their ability.

example.ex: Students are already being tracked.
example.tran: 学生已经按能力分班了。

entry.tran: 掩盖行踪;隐匿身份(或活动)
entry.def: If someone covers their tracks, they hide or destroy evidence of their identity or their actions, because they want to keep them secret.

example.ex: He covered his tracks, burnt letters and diaries...
example.tran: 他掩盖形迹，烧毁了信件与日记。

example.ex: The killer may have returned to the scene of the crime to cover his tracks.
example.tran: 凶手可能曾回到犯罪现场掩盖自己的罪行。

entry.tran: 占优势;处于有利地位;了解内情
entry.def: If you say that someone has the inside track, you mean that they have an advantage, for example special knowledge about something.

example.ex: Denver has the inside track among 10 sites being considered...
example.tran: 丹佛在 10 个被考虑的地点之中具有优势。

example.ex: As an agent, you may have an inside track when good deals become available.
example.tran: 作为代理人，一旦有划算的买卖你恐怕能近水楼台先得月。

entry.tran: 跟上…的进展;掌握…的最新消息
entry.def: If you keep track of a situation or a person, you make sure that you have the newest and most accurate information about them all the time.

example.ex: With eleven thousand employees, it's very difficult to keep track of them all...
example.tran: 对于一支 1.1 万人的员工队伍，很难及时了解到所有有人的动态。

example.ex: It's hard to keep track of time in here.
example.tran: 在这里很容易忘了时间。

entry.tran: 跟不上…的进展;不再掌握…的最新情况
entry.def: If you lose track of someone or something, you no longer know where they are or what is happening.

example.ex: You become so deeply absorbed in an activity that you lose track of time...
example.tran: 你会因过于专注某项活动而失去时间概念。

example.ex: It's so easy to lose track of who's playing who and when.
example.tran: 很容易就忘记谁要和谁比赛，什么时候比。

entry.def: If you make tracks, you leave the place where you are, especially when you are in a hurry.

example.ex: We'd better make tracks soon, hadn't we?
example.tran: 我们最好马上就走，不是吗？

entry.def: If someone or something is on track, they are acting or progressing in a way that is likely to result in success.

example.ex: It may take some time to get the British economy back on track...
example.tran: 要使英国经济重新回到正轨可能需要一段时间。

example.ex: David put me back on track…
example.tran: 戴维让我重新回到了正轨。

entry.def: If you are on the track of someone or something, you are trying to find them, or find information about them.

example.ex: He was on the track of an escaped criminal...
example.tran: 他正在追踪一名逃犯。

example.ex: The research institute is on the track of what causes the artery damage.
example.tran: 研究所正在探究动脉损伤的诱因。

entry.tran: 循着正确/错误的路线;在正确/错误的道路上
entry.def: If you are on the right track, you are acting or progressing in a way that is likely to result in success. If you are on the wrong track, you are acting or progressing in a way that is likely to result in failure.

example.ex: Guests are returning in increasing numbers — a sure sign that we are on the right track...
example.tran: 回头客越来越多了——这显然表明我们的路走对了。

example.ex: We need a convincing win to put us back on the right track…
example.tran: 我们需要一场令人信服的大胜，以重回正轨。

entry.def: If someone or something stops you in your tracks, or if you stop dead in your tracks, you suddenly stop moving because you are very surprised, impressed, or frightened.

example.ex: This magnificent church cannot fail to stop you in your tracks…
example.tran: 这座宏伟的教堂一定会让你止步赞叹。

example.ex: They stopped in their tracks and stared at him in amazement…
example.tran: 他们突然停下，惊讶地盯着他。

entry.def: If someone or something stops a process or activity in its tracks, or if it stops dead in its tracks, they prevent the process or activity from continuing.

example.ex: Francis felt he would like to stop this conversation in its tracks…
example.tran: 弗朗西斯觉得他应该立即打断这一谈话。

example.ex: U.S. manufacturers may find the export boom stopping dead in its tracks.
example.tran: 美国制造商将会发现出口热戛然而止。

auth_sentence.content: They have tracked millions of dollars of military assets.
auth_sentence.res_content: They have tracked millions of dollars of military assets.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: They have tracked millions of dollars of military assets.

auth_sentence.content: They tracked down his books, and read them.
auth_sentence.res_content: They tracked down his books, and read them.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: They tracked down his books, and read them.

auth_sentence.content: Every...aircraft flying over Europe can be tracked by radar.
auth_sentence.res_content: Every...aircraft flying over Europe can be tracked by radar.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Every...aircraft flying over Europe can be tracked by radar.
